fields.Title: KIM SWITCH / DAY TWO UNION
fields.Description: Kim blinks red when he's joined your team near the stairs. He wants to tell you the vigilantes have showed up and that you should talk to them -- but be careful. (Final warning about RCM non-presence in Martinaise.)

fields.Title: Authority: "Good. A power move. *Purposefully*..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Good. A power move. *Purposefully* concentrate on something else first.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And one more thing..." He pulls th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "And one more thing..." He pulls the black plastic over the dead man's face, then looks at you. "This was *very* good work, detective."

fields.Title: Interfacing: "Oh well -- we'll get the armoured b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Oh well -- we'll get the armoured boots in another lifetime.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like we can get to work at o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Looks like we can get to work at once. The Union muscle turned up." He points to the mess hall doors. "They look rowdy. We should talk to them."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "The lieutenant is downplaying his c..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant is downplaying his contribution -- he got up before sunrise to get this done. And now he's quite pleased with himself for taking care of the gruesome business so efficiently.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That would just escalate tensions...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That would just escalate tensions. No captain would sign off on it. Solving one murder isn't worth a conflict between the RCM and the DÃ©bardeurs' Union."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I've got some good news." The lieu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I've got some good news." The lieutenant smiles. "I took care of the body. The thought of him decomposing in my MC wouldn't let me sleep."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And the big one," he squints his e..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "And the big one," he squints his eyes, studying the men in the mess hall, "must be Hardie himself..."

fields.Title: Empathy: "He kind of wishes you'd acknowledge..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He kind of wishes you'd acknowledged his contribution, but you've missed your opportunity now.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Men who drink beer for breakfast...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Men who drink beer for breakfast. I have no doubt these are the Hardie boys Evrart told us about, the ones who *keep the peace* around here."

fields.Title: Logic: "But... aren't you *curious* to know..."
fields.Dialogue Text: But... aren't you *curious* to know what they have to say about the murder?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Everything points to the Dockworke..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Everything points to the Dockworkers' Union: the tracks in the mud, the circumstances in Martinaise, my preliminary information..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Which may, of course, all be wrong..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Which may, of course, all be wrong. But we still need to talk to them -- and it won't be easy."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm just glad he's gone. We have o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm just glad he's gone. We have other matters to attend to."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""One loose thread less to worry abo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "One loose thread less to worry about -- and one big problem to replace it." He crosses something out.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, he's in processing now. We h..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Well, he's in processing now. We have other matters to attend to."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm just glad he's gone. We have o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm just glad he's gone. We have other matters to attend to."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We can't be sure of course -- Evra..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "We can't be sure of course -- Evrart may have lied to us. He definitely has an agenda of his own. Either way, we need to interview them. And it won't be easy."

fields.Title: You: ""Are these the men Garte told us ab..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Are these the men Garte told us about yesterday?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He points to the mess hall doors. "..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He points to the mess hall doors. "The Union muscle finally turned up, and they look rowdy. We need to talk to them."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""...that's not *a lot* of things. W..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "...that's not *a lot* of things. We should have dug up more yesterday. Still, we need to talk to them. And it won't be easy."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They're in no hurry to leave -- th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "They're in no hurry to leave -- they think they own the place... Anyway, I leave that choice to you. Whatever you decide is fine by me."

fields.Title: You: ""I don't know if I was ready to let..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't know if I was ready to let him go..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I completely forgot." He looks at..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I completely forgot." He looks at his notes. "Sorry, I had a rough night's sleep. It's them, by the looks of it -- loud and nasty, just like the manager said."

fields.Title: You: ""Good, thanks.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Good, thanks."

fields.Title: Composure: "He won't even *acknowledge* the sto..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He won't even *acknowledge* the stolen boots you're wearing. For him, they don't exist. You'll have to bring it up yourself, later -- *if* you dare.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In fact, even the *death* of two d..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "In fact, even the *death* of two detectives might not warrant an all-out war. So let's keep a cool head, okay?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like we can get to work at o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Looks like we can get to work at once. The Union muscle turned up." He points to the mess hall doors. "They look rowdy. We should talk to them."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A lot of things point to the Dockw..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "A lot of things point to the Dockworkers' Union: the circumstances in Martinaise, my preliminary information. Hmm, actually..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, he's in processing now. We h..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Well, he's in processing now. We have other matters to attend to."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I mean ungovernable. Martinaise is..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I mean ungovernable. Martinaise isn't exactly enthusiastic about the RCM being here. They prefer to be *policed* by the Union -- these men here..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This is clearly the Union's *peace..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "This is clearly the Union's *peacekeeping* force Evrart told us about. The one he said hanged our victim."

fields.Title: Interfacing: "Oh well -- we'll get the armoured b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Oh well -- we'll get the armoured boots in another lifetime.

fields.Title: You: ""Why do we need to talk to them?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Why do we need to talk to them?"

fields.Title: You: ""What do you mean 'rowdy'?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What do you mean 'rowdy'?"

fields.Title: You: ""There are so many of them. Maybe w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "There are so many of them. Maybe we should call in reinforcements?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""One more thing before we do..." He..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "One more thing before we do..." He glances at the booth again. "We don't have to talk to them immediately. We can walk right past them, continue with our business."

fields.Title: Half Light: "He's not exaggerating about that mo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He's not exaggerating about that mortal danger. Just calmly factoring it in. Your fists clench and your pulse rises uncomfortably.

fields.Title: Reaction Speed: "Yeah -- streetwise. Zoom right past..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yeah -- streetwise. Zoom right past, do it on your own terms.

fields.Title: You: ""Let's roll." [Leave.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: "Let's roll." [Leave.]

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Everything points to the Dockworke..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Everything points to the Dockworkers' Union: the *belt* used for hanging him, the circumstances in Martinaise, my preliminary information..."
fields.Alternate1: "Everything points to the Dockworkers' Union: the belt used for hanging him, tracks in the mud, the circumstances in Martinaise, my preliminary information..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Men who drink beer for breakfast?..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Men who drink beer for breakfast? There's talk of an armed wing of the Union called *the Hardie boys*, who are responsible for said *policing*. I think it's them."
